p: From 846 municipalities that reported chikungunya cases between 2014 and 2016 we selected 85 that had a recognizable epidemic peak and reported more than 150 cases. The chosen municipalities comprised approximately 65.6% of Colombian reported cases ( Fig 1). From those municipalities, the range of cases reported over the two years of peak CHIKV incidence in Colombia was 151 (city of Soledad) to 4179 cases (city of Cali). The city of Turbaco reported the highest number of cases in a single week, which was 589 cases.
